June 26, 1956
Director of Radio
Station KXLU
Loyola University of Los Angeles
Los Angeles, California
Dear Sir:
We are very pleased to see that Loyola University of
Los Angeles has been granted a CP for a new educational
station. The forces of educational broaocasting are growing
STRONGER EVERY DAY, AND, AS THE ASSOCIATION OF EDUCATIONAL
stations in the United States, we feel that you will be
INTERESTED IN LEARNING SOMETHING ABOUT OUR ORGANIZATION AND
THE SERVICES IT PROVIDES TO MEMBERS. INCIDENTALLY, BETTER
THAN 90% OF ALL EDUCATIONAL RADIO AND TELEVISION STATIONS IN
the United States belong to the NAEB.
I AM ENCLOSING SOME MATERIAL WHICH WILL GIVE YOU MORE DETAILS
ABOUT THE ASSOCIATION, AND UNDER SEPARATE COVER AM SENDING
SAMPLES OF THE REPORTS, SURVEYS AND OTHER SERVICES WE REGULARLY
MAKE AVAILABLE TO MEMBER STATIONS.
Annual oues in the Association, including a subscription to our
monthly Newsletter and the above mentioned materials, are based
ON RATED TRANSMITTER POWER, A3 FOLLOWS 5
Class A - 5 kw and over -
Class B - 1 - k*9 kw - 25.00
Class C * Less than 1 kw - 15.OO
In ADDITION TO THE ABOVE, MEMBER STATIONS ENJOY THE BENEFITS
of our Placement Service, legal counsel, help in meeting day-
to-day PROBLEMS, THE OPPORTUNITY TO MEET, IN SEMINARS, CONFER¬
ENCES AND CONVENTIONS, WITH OTHER EDUCATIONAL BROADCASTERS TO
CONSIDER MUTUAL PROBLEMS, AND, FOR THE PAYMENT OF AN ADDITIONAL
ASSESSMENT FEE, THE USE OF OUR TAPE NETWORK.
The NAEB Network, which distributes over I4.OO hours of program¬
ing, VIA TAPE RECORDING, PER YEAR, IS OPEN ONLY TO MEMBERS OF
the Association. Through the Network you have an opportunity
TO BROADCAST SOME OF THE BEST EDUCATIONAL PROGRAMS FROM ALL OVER
THE COUNTRY AS WELL AS A CHANCE TO HAVE SOME OF YOUR 8ETTER
PROGRAMS RECEIVE WIDER DISTRIBUTION. In ADDITION, BEING ABLE TO
RELY ON THE NETWORK FOR EIGHT OR MORE HOURS OF PROGRAMMING PER
WEEK PERMITS YOUR STAFF TO SPEND MORE TIME ON THE DEVELOPMENT OF
OUTSTANDING PROGRAMS.
